title: Emergency Disconnect Sequence (EDS)
content: Emergency Disconnect Sequence is the controlled separation of the LMRP from the subsea BOP stack. EDS is executed when the drilling unit must move off location urgently—severe weather, vessel drive-off, ice, or uncontrolled well situation where maintaining connection is more dangerous than disconnecting. EDS must secure the well before separation.

multiSensoryExplanations.visual: EDS is like ejecting from a fighter jet—you don't want to do it, but when you must, it happens fast and in a precise sequence. Seat belt releases, canopy blows, seat fires. In EDS: shear rams close, LMRP releases, riser comes up. Each step in order.
multiSensoryExplanations.auditory: E-D-S: Emergency Disconnect Sequence. Say each step: 'Shear-Seal-Separate.' The rams shear pipe, seal the well, then LMRP separates. Three actions, that order, no deviation.
multiSensoryExplanations.kinesthetic: Practice the sequence with hand motions. Fist (shear)—slam hands together. Open palms facing (seal)—press together tight. Pull hands apart (separate)—LMRP away. Feel the urgency and finality of each step.
multiSensoryExplanations.storyBased: During Deepwater Horizon, EDS was initiated but failed to fully shear the drill pipe. The investigation found multiple factors—pipe position, battery condition, maintenance issues. That failure became the world's largest oil spill. EDS must work every time, first time. There is no second chance.

automated: 1. Operator initiates EDS at control panel
2. System closes BSR (Blind Shear Rams)—cuts drill pipe and seals well
3. System closes CSO (Casing Shear) if pipe is larger than BSR capacity
6. LMRP rises with riser as rig moves off

manual.description: If automated fails, ROV intervention or acoustic backup may be used

beforeEDS: Confirm all personnel clear of moonpool
Riser tensioner set to disconnect mode
Diverter open or overboard line configured
Rig positioned for clean disconnect (if possible)

mcq.question: What is the PRIMARY function of the Blind Shear Rams during EDS?

options.B: To shear the drill pipe and seal the wellbore
options.C: To pump kill mud into the well

mcq.explanation: Blind Shear Rams cut through drill pipe and seal the wellbore in one action. This is the critical well-securing step before the LMRP can safely disconnect.

advancedQuestion.question: Your vessel is experiencing drive-off toward an adjacent platform. You have 15 minutes before riser angle exceeds safe limits. The tool joint is positioned across the BSR. What are your options?
advancedQuestion.answer: Options: (1) Attempt to move pipe to position connection away from BSR (if time allows and pumps/drawworks available); (2) Execute EDS anyway—some BSR designs can shear tool joints, verify your BOP specs; (3) If BSR cannot shear tool joint, use Casing Shear Rams first (designed for larger diameters), then seal with BSR; (4) Accept partial shear and immediate disconnect, understanding well may not be fully sealed—requires post-incident intervention. This decision weighs certain rig damage from over-angle against uncertain well control outcome. Time pressure makes this a critical L4 judgment call.
advancedQuestion.l4Focus: Supervisors must understand BOP limitations and make real-time decisions about EDS execution.

backupSystems.deadman: Automatically triggers EDS if communication and power are lost to BOP for specified time
backupSystems.autoshear: Triggers EDS if LMRP physically separates from BOP stack
backupSystems.acoustic: Independent acoustic signal can trigger EDS remotely
backupSystems.rov: ROV can manually operate intervention panel to trigger EDS

commonMisconception.wrong: EDS is automatic—just push a button and walk away.
commonMisconception.correct: EDS is semi-automatic. The driller initiates, but must verify sequencing, monitor execution, and be prepared to intervene if something fails. Post-EDS, the well is secured but not killed—further intervention will be required.

testingRequirements.frequency: Per API RP 53 and company policy
